column4: hey guys, i'm trying to install a new version of amarok (newer than 5.10 includes) this is what bugtraq (http://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=16375) says: 1.3.5 is now on the Kubuntu website for Breezy installs, marking this Fixed.
(1.3.5 is a newer version that i would like to run)
how can i install this package?
or /etc/smb.conf on a lot of other os'
can i install kubuntu packages on ubuntu?
can i just add this to my sources.lst ?
yeah, add the correct sources.list entry :)
add the user that needs to access it to the fuse group
and as that user, use sshfs
you can visit that first url and manually download the deb or add that what I gave later to sources.list :)
